chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat
a: nat

Goal:
map S (list_an a n) = list_an (S a) n

Premises:
list_an = fix list_an (a n : nat) {struct n} : list nat := match n with | 0 => nil | S n0 => a :: list_an (S a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments list_an (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
map : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> list A -> list B
list_an_S : forall a n : nat, list_an a (S n) = a :: list_an (S a) n
list_an_plus : forall a n m : nat, list_an a (n + m) = list_an a n ++ list_an (n + a) m
list_an_length : forall a n : nat, length (list_an a n) = n
list_an_spec : forall a n m : nat, In m (list_an a n) < -> a <= m < a + n
map_ext_in : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B) (l : list A), (forall a : A, In a l -> f a = g a) -> map f l = map g l
map_ext : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B), (forall a : A, f a = g a) -> forall l : list A, map f l = map g l
seq_shift : forall len start : nat, map S (seq start len) = seq (S start) len
firstn_cons : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (a : A) (l : list A), firstn (S n) (a :: l) = a :: firstn n l
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_succ : forall n : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat (S n) = BinInt.Z.succ (BinInt.Z.of_nat n)
seq = fix seq (start len : nat) {struct len} : list nat := match len with | 0 => nil | S len0 => start :: seq (S start) len0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments seq (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
ZifyClasses.mkrel : forall (S T : Type) (R : S -> S -> Prop) (I : S -> T) (TR : T -> T -> Prop), (forall n m : S, R n m <-> TR (I n) (I m)) -> forall (s1 : S) (t1 : T), I s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S) (t2 : T), I s2 = t2 -> R s1 s2 < -> TR t1 t2
ext_in_map : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B) (l : list A), map f l = map g l -> forall a : A, In a l -> f a = g a
Init.Nat.max = fix max (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S n' => match m with | 0 => n | S m' => S (max n' m') end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.max (_ _)%nat_scope
ZMicromega.xhyps_of_pt = fix xhyps_of_pt (base : nat) (acc : list nat) (pt : ZMicromega.ZArithProof) {struct pt} : list nat := match pt with | ZMicromega.DoneProof => acc | ZMicromega.RatProof c pt0 | ZMicromega.CutProof c pt0 => xhyps_of_pt (S base) (RingMicromega.xhyps_of_psatz base acc c) pt0 | ZMicromega.EnumProof c1 c2 l => let acc0 := RingMicromega.xhyps_of_psatz base (RingMicromega.xhyps_of_psatz base acc c2) c1 in fold_left (xhyps_of_pt (S base)) l acc0 | ZMicromega.ExProof _ pt0 => xhyps_of_pt (S (S (S base))) acc pt0 end : nat -> list nat ->...-> list nat Arguments ZMicromega.xhyps_of_pt _%nat_scope _%list_scope
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
map_last : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (a : A), map f (l ++ a :: nil) = map f l ++ f a :: nil
skipn_cons : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (a : A) (l : list A), skipn (S n) (a :: l) = skipn n l
BinNatDef.N.div_eucl = fun a b : BinNums.N => match a with | BinNums.N0 => (BinNums.N0, BinNums.N0) | BinNums.Npos na => match b with | BinNums.N0 => (BinNums.N0, a) | BinNums.Npos _ => BinNatDef.N.pos_div_eucl na b end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N * BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.div_eucl (_ _)%N_scope
Tauto.map_simpl : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A), map f l = match l with | nil => nil | a :: l0 => f a :: map f l0 end
removelast_firstn : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (l : list A), n < length l -> removelast (firstn (S n) l) = firstn n l
RingMicromega.ge_bool = fix ge_bool (n m : nat) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0 => match m with | 0 => true | S _ => false end | S n0 => match m with | 0 => true | S m0 => ge_bool n0 m0 end end : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments RingMicromega.ge_bool (_ _)%nat_scope
map_ext_in_iff : map ?f ?l = map ?g ?l < -> (forall a0 : ?A, In a0 ?l -> ?f a0 = ?g a0) where ?A : [a : nat n : nat |- Type] ?B : [a : nat n : nat |- Type] ?f : [a : nat n : nat |- ?A -> ?B] ?g : [a : nat n : nat |- ?A -> ?B] ?l : [a : nat n : nat |- list ?A]
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.Z0 | S n0 => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_nat _%nat_scope
map_eq_cons : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (l' : list B) (b : B), map f l = b :: l' -> exists (a : A) (tl : list A), l = a :: tl /\ f a = b /\ map f tl = l'
BinNatDef.N.to_nat = fun a : BinNums.N => match a with | BinNums.N0 => 0 | BinNums.Npos p => BinPos.Pos.to_nat p end : BinNums.N -> nat Arguments BinNatDef.N.to_nat _%N_scope
Permutation_image : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (a : B) (l : list B) (l' : list A), a :: l ~p map f l' -> exists a' : A, a = f a'
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
